feedback_text: We propose adding volume-based discount tiers for quarterly orders exceeding 10,000 units. This would incentivize bulk ordering and provide cost savings for both parties.
We suggest including a provision for expedited delivery (24-48 hours) for emergency replacement needs, with an agreed premium charge of 15% for such urgent orders.
The ISO 9001:2015 quality standards are clear, but we'd like to add ISO 14644 Class 7 cleanroom certification for filters designated for critical power generation equipment.
The 60-day payment term is longer than our standard 30-day terms. We request consideration for either 45-day payment terms or early payment discount of 2% for payments within 15 days.
We request an adjustment to the pricing escalation clause to use the Consumer Price Index (CPI) instead of a fixed 5% annual increase. This better reflects actual market conditions.
The proposed delivery timeline of 90 days is too aggressive given current supply chain constraints. We recommend extending to 120 days.
Please clarify the testing methodology for the quality acceptance criteria. We want to ensure alignment with international standards.
We propose adjusting the equity split from 60-40 to 55-45 to better reflect our technology contribution and operational responsibilities.
We suggest adding a technical advisory board with equal representation to facilitate joint decision-making on technical matters.
The current exit clause heavily favors one party. We need more balanced terms for both parties in case of dissolution.
Request to reduce emergency response time from 4 hours to 2 hours for critical failures to minimize production downtime.
We propose adding a tiered SLA structure with different response times based on issue severity levels (Critical, High, Medium, Low).
The penalty clause for SLA violations appears excessive at 10% of monthly fees. Industry standard is typically 3-5%. We request a more reasonable penalty structure.
Can you clarify the scheduled maintenance windows? Our operations run 24/7 and we need advance notice of at least 2 weeks for planned maintenance.
We request changing payment terms from monthly advance to quarterly arrears to align with our standard vendor payment cycles.
We suggest adding an early payment discount of 2% if invoices are paid within 10 days to incentivize prompt payment.
Request to extend warranty period from 12 months to 24 months for major equipment components, aligned with manufacturer warranties.
The force majeure clause should explicitly include pandemic events, cyberattacks, and supply chain disruptions as covered events.
